page.title: 15DISAPPEARING FOOTPATHS
page.content: East Sussex Highways Authority have ultimate responsibility for clearing footpaths and marking them where they meet up with highways, but resources are limited. There is an appreciable network of footpaths around Fletching and some 20 years ago a group was formed (mainly Womens Institute) to walk, clear and mark them, with arrows along their route. Work gradually lapsed and this year Fletching Parish Council called together interested parties to form a permanent footpath group. The W.I. again showed most interest. Their first task will be to establish ownership of boundaries and from this deduce who is responsible for stiles. They will resume light clearing and marking and may possibly approach local landowners about closing or ploughing up paths. {D Skan}
